definition: wing/area surrounding the bullseye of a target/to assist/one of the 28 constellations of Chinese astronomy/old variant of 翌
surname Yi/alternative name for 絳|绛[Jiang4] capital of the Jin State during the Spring and Autumn Period (770-475 BC)

sentences.english: She was wearing a dress of diaphanous silk.
sentences.chinese: 她穿着一件薄如蝉翼的绸服。

sentences.english: See the cage had been cicada wing, no result map Lutai.
sentences.chinese: 已见笼蝉翼，无因映鹿胎。

sentences.english: After a downpour, a cicada, its wings thoroughly soaked, could no longer fly.
sentences.chinese: 急雨之后，蝉翼湿得不能再飞了。

sentences.english: She wore a white organdy blouse.
sentences.chinese: 她穿著一件白色蝉翼纱上衣。

definition: pure and limpid/(of a person) quick-witted
to wrap tightly/to wind tightly/to bind/close-fitting (clothes)
meager/slight/weak/ungenerous or unkind/frivolous/to despise/to belittle/to look down on/to approach or near
to wrap up/(fig.) to envelop/to swallow up
